intro: Cryptantha humilis var. nana, commonly known as the dwarf cryptantha, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from March to May. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
